The Elder Vatthadāyaka’s Birth Story
“At that time I was born as a bird,
a Supaṇṇa, a lord of Garuḍas.
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
going to Gandhamādana.
Giving up my Garuḍa form,🔽I took on the appearance of a young brahmin.
I gave a single cloth

analyzed: dvipad indassa tādinaḥ  tat ca dussam paṭiggayha
translated: to the one with two feet, the one with fortitude.
The Buddha, the leader of the world,🔽accepted that cloth.
The Teacher, standing in the sky,
recited these verses:
‘By this gift of cloth,
and by the aspiration of the mind,
having left behind the Garuḍa birth,
he will delight in the heavenly world.’
The Blessed One, the one who sees what is beneficial,
the elder of the world, the bull among men,
having praised the gift of cloth,
went off to the north.
Whenever I was reborn in existence,
I had the perfect cloth.
There was a covering in the sky;
this is the fruit of the gift of cloth.
Seven people with the color of dawn,
wheel-turning monarchs of great strength,
were in the thirty-six eons,
rulers of men.
The four discriminations,
